column4: ntp wasn't configured right out of the box ('can't find host start' error). what should i do?
wlan is unfortunately started after ntp so there this error is a known bug.... but on desktops the net should be up already
running the ntp daemon from terminal within the desktop produces a 'can't find host start' error
ah, i thought you mean the startup
im assuming it failed there too. didn't notice.
it would show up red if it failed on boot
fine so hal is there too
but i can't run the 'removeable storage' app because hald is not running, supposedly
hmm. it seems to stop periodically. i had to do that just a few minutes after i first did it. still doesn't recognize my external hd though :-/
